page.title: Knowledge of div. things from Revelation

revision.text: Possibly: The Knowledge of divine things from revelation, not from reason or nature. Wherein the origin and obligation of religious truths are demonstrated; arguments of Deists, Moralists, etc. proved to have no foundation. ... By a Gentleman of Brazen-Nose College, Oxford, now of the Diocese of Chester [i.e. John Ellis, D.D.]. (London, 1743). http://www.worldcat.org/oclc/562029166
